  16. (* From lambda to assembly code *)

  18. [@@@ocaml.warning "+a-4-9-40-41-42"]

  20. open Format
  21. open Config
  22. open Clflags
  23. open Misc
  24. open Cmm

  26. ‌type error =
  27.   | Assembler_error of string
  28.   | Mismatched_for_pack of string option
  29.   | Asm_generation of string * Emitaux.error

  31. exception Error of error

  33. ‌let cmm_invariants ppf fd_cmm =
  34.   let print_fundecl =
  35.     if !Clflags.dump_cmm then Printcmm.fundecl
  36.     else fun ppf fdecl -> Format.fprintf ppf "%s" fdecl.fun_name
  37.   in
  38.   if !Clflags.cmm_invariants && Cmm_invariants.run ppf fd_cmm then
  39.     Misc.fatal_errorf "Cmm invariants failed on following fundecl:@.%a@."
  40.       print_fundecl fd_cmm;
  41.   fd_cmm

  43. ‌let liveness phrase = Liveness.fundecl phrase; phrase

  45. ‌let dump_if ppf flag message phrase =
  46.   if !flag then Printmach.phase message ppf phrase

  48. ‌let pass_dump_if ppf flag message phrase =
  49.   dump_if ppf flag message phrase; phrase

  51. ‌let pass_dump_linear_if ppf flag message phrase =
  52.   if !flag then fprintf ppf "*** %s@.%a@." message Printlinear.fundecl phrase;
  53.   phrase

  55. ‌let start_from_emit = ref true

  57. ‌let should_save_before_emit () =
  58.   should_save_ir_after Compiler_pass.Scheduling && (not !start_from_emit)

  60. ‌let linear_unit_info =
  61.   { Linear_format.unit_name = "";
  62.     items = [];
  63.     for_pack = None;
  64.   }

  66. let reset () =
  67.   start_from_emit := false;
  68.   if should_save_before_emit () then begin
  69.     linear_unit_info.unit_name <- Compilenv.current_unit_name ();
  70.     linear_unit_info.items <- [];
  71.     linear_unit_info.for_pack <- !Clflags.for_package;
  72.   end

  74. ‌let save_data dl =
  75.   if should_save_before_emit () then begin
  76.     linear_unit_info.items <- Linear_format.(Data dl) :: linear_unit_info.items
  77.   end;
  78.   dl

  80. ‌let save_linear f =
  81.   if should_save_before_emit () then begin
  82.     linear_unit_info.items <- Linear_format.(Func f) :: linear_unit_info.items
  83.   end;
  84.   f

  86. ‌let write_linear prefix =
  87.   if should_save_before_emit () then begin
  88.     let filename = Compiler_pass.(to_output_filename Scheduling ~prefix) in
  89.     linear_unit_info.items <- List.rev linear_unit_info.items;
  90.     Linear_format.save filename linear_unit_info
  91.   end

  93. let should_emit () =
  94.   not (should_stop_after Compiler_pass.Scheduling)

  96. ‌let if_emit_do f x = if should_emit () then f x else ()
  97. ‌let emit_begin_assembly = if_emit_do Emit.begin_assembly
  98. ‌let emit_end_assembly = if_emit_do Emit.end_assembly
  99. ‌let emit_data = if_emit_do Emit.data
  100. ‌let emit_fundecl fd =
  101.   if should_emit() then begin
  102.     try
  103.       Profile.record ~accumulate:true "emit" Emit.fundecl fd
  104.     with Emitaux.Error e ->
  105.       raise (Error (Asm_generation(fd.Linear.fun_name, e)))
  106.   end

  108. let rec regalloc ~ppf_dump round fd =
  109.   if round > 50 then
  110.     fatal_error(fd.Mach.fun_name ^
  111.                 ": function too complex, cannot complete register allocation");
  112.   dump_if ppf_dump dump_live "Liveness analysis" fd;
  113.   let num_stack_slots =
  114.     if !use_linscan then begin
  115.       (* Linear Scan *)
  116.       let intervals = Interval.build_intervals fd in
  117.       if !dump_interval then Printmach.intervals ppf_dump intervals;
  118.       Linscan.allocate_registers intervals
  119.     end else begin
  120.       (* Graph Coloring *)
  121.       Interf.build_graph fd;
  122.       if !dump_interf then Printmach.interferences ppf_dump ();
  123.       if !dump_prefer then Printmach.preferences ppf_dump ();
  124.       Coloring.allocate_registers()
  125.     end
  126.   in
  127.   dump_if ppf_dump dump_regalloc "After register allocation" fd;
  128. ‌  let (newfd, redo_regalloc) = Reload.fundecl fd num_stack_slots in
  129.   dump_if ppf_dump dump_reload "After insertion of reloading code" newfd;
  130.   if redo_regalloc then begin
  131.     Reg.reinit(); Liveness.fundecl newfd; regalloc ~ppf_dump (round + 1) newfd
  132.   end else newfd

  134. ‌let (++) x f = f x

  136. ‌let compile_fundecl ~ppf_dump ~funcnames fd_cmm =
  137.   Proc.init ();
  138.   Reg.reset();
  139.   fd_cmm
  140.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "cmm_invariants" (cmm_invariants ppf_dump)
  141.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "selection"
  142.                     (Selection.fundecl ~future_funcnames:funcnames)
  143.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "polling"
  144.                     (Polling.instrument_fundecl ~future_funcnames:funcnames)
  145.   ++ pass_dump_if ppf_dump dump_selection "After instruction selection"
  146.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "comballoc" Comballoc.fundecl
  147.   ++ pass_dump_if ppf_dump dump_combine "After allocation combining"
  148.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "cse" CSE.fundecl
  149.   ++ pass_dump_if ppf_dump dump_cse "After CSE"
  150.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "liveness" liveness
  151.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "deadcode" Deadcode.fundecl
  152.   ++ pass_dump_if ppf_dump dump_live "Liveness analysis"
  153.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "spill" Spill.fundecl
  154.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "liveness" liveness
  155.   ++ pass_dump_if ppf_dump dump_spill "After spilling"
  156.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "split" Split.fundecl
  157.   ++ pass_dump_if ppf_dump dump_split "After live range splitting"
  158.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "liveness" liveness
  159.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "regalloc" (regalloc ~ppf_dump 1)
  160.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "linearize" Linearize.fundecl
  161.   ++ pass_dump_linear_if ppf_dump dump_linear "Linearized code"
  162.   ++ Profile.record ~accumulate:true "scheduling" Scheduling.fundecl
  163.   ++ pass_dump_linear_if ppf_dump dump_scheduling "After instruction scheduling"
  164.   ++ save_linear
  165.   ++ emit_fundecl

  167. module String = Misc.Stdlib.String

  169. let compile_data dl =
  170.   dl
  171.   ++ save_data
  172.   ++ emit_data

  174. let compile_phrases ~ppf_dump ps =
  175.   let funcnames =
  176.     List.fold_left (fun s p ->
  177.         match p with
  178.         | Cfunction fd -> String.Set.add fd.fun_name s
  179.         | Cdata _ -> s)
  180.       String.Set.empty ps
  181.   in
  182.   let rec compile ~funcnames ps =
  183.     match ps with
  184.     | [] -> ()
  185.     | p :: ps ->
  186.        if !dump_cmm then fprintf ppf_dump "%a@." Printcmm.phrase p;
  187.        match p with
  188.        | Cfunction fd ->
  189.           compile_fundecl ~ppf_dump ~funcnames fd;
  190.           compile ~funcnames:(String.Set.remove fd.fun_name funcnames) ps
  191.        | Cdata dl ->
  192.           compile_data dl;
  193.           compile ~funcnames ps
  194.   in
  195.   compile ~funcnames ps

  197. let compile_phrase ~ppf_dump p =
  198.   compile_phrases ~ppf_dump [p]

  200. (* For the native toplevel: generates generic functions unless
  201.    they are already available in the process *)
  202. let compile_genfuns ~ppf_dump f =
  203.   List.iter
  204.     (function
  205.        | (Cfunction {fun_name = name}) as ph when f name ->
  206.            compile_phrase ~ppf_dump ph
  207.        | _ -> ())
  208.     (Cmm_helpers.generic_functions true [Compilenv.current_unit_infos ()])

  210. let compile_unit ~output_prefix ~asm_filename ~keep_asm ~obj_filename gen =
  211.   reset ();
  212.   let create_asm = should_emit () &&
  213.                    (keep_asm || not !Emitaux.binary_backend_available) in
  214.   Emitaux.create_asm_file := create_asm;
  215.   let remove_asm_file () =
  216.     (* if [should_emit ()] is [false] then no assembly is generated,
  217.        so the (empty) temporary file should be deleted. *)
  218.     if not create_asm || not keep_asm then remove_file asm_filename
  219.   in
  220.   Misc.try_finally
  221.     ~exceptionally:(fun () -> remove_file obj_filename)
  222.     (fun () ->
  223.        if create_asm then Emitaux.output_channel := open_out asm_filename;
  224.        Misc.try_finally
  225.          (fun () ->
  226.             gen ();
  227.             write_linear output_prefix)
  228.          ~always:(fun () ->
  229.              if create_asm then close_out !Emitaux.output_channel)
  230.          ~exceptionally:remove_asm_file;
  231.        if should_emit () then begin
  232.          let assemble_result =
  233.            Profile.record "assemble"
  234.              (Proc.assemble_file asm_filename) obj_filename
  235.          in
  236.          if assemble_result <> 0
  237.          then raise(Error(Assembler_error asm_filename));
  238.        end;
  239.        remove_asm_file ()
  240.     )

  242. ‌let end_gen_implementation ?toplevel ~ppf_dump
  243.     (clambda : Clambda.with_constants) =
  244.   emit_begin_assembly ();
  245.   clambda
  246.   ++ Profile.record "cmm" Cmmgen.compunit
  247.   ++ Profile.record "compile_phrases" (compile_phrases ~ppf_dump)
  248.   ++ (fun () -> ());
  249.   (match toplevel with None -> () | Some f -> compile_genfuns ~ppf_dump f);
  250.   (* We add explicit references to external primitive symbols.  This
  251.      is to ensure that the object files that define these symbols,
  252.      when part of a C library, won't be discarded by the linker.
  253.      This is important if a module that uses such a symbol is later
  254.      dynlinked. *)
  255.   compile_phrase ~ppf_dump
  256.     (Cmm_helpers.reference_symbols
  257.        (List.filter_map (fun prim ->
  258.            if not (Primitive.native_name_is_external prim) then None
  259.            else Some (Primitive.native_name prim))
  260.           !Translmod.primitive_declarations));
  261.   emit_end_assembly ()

  263. ‌type middle_end =
  264.      backend:(module Backend_intf.S)
  265.   -> prefixname:string
  266.   -> ppf_dump:Format.formatter
  267.   -> Lambda.program
  268.   -> Clambda.with_constants

  270. let asm_filename output_prefix =
  271.     if !keep_asm_file || !Emitaux.binary_backend_available
  272.     then output_prefix ^ ext_asm
  273.     else Filename.temp_file "camlasm" ext_asm

  275. let compile_implementation ?toplevel ~backend ~prefixname ~middle_end
  276.       ~ppf_dump (program : Lambda.program) =
  277.   compile_unit ~output_prefix:prefixname
  278.     ~asm_filename:(asm_filename prefixname) ~keep_asm:!keep_asm_file
  279.     ~obj_filename:(prefixname ^ ext_obj)
  280.     (fun () ->
  281.       Ident.Set.iter Compilenv.require_global program.required_globals;
  282.       let clambda_with_constants =
  283.         middle_end ~backend ~prefixname ~ppf_dump program
  284.       in
  285.       end_gen_implementation ?toplevel ~ppf_dump clambda_with_constants)

  287. let linear_gen_implementation filename =
  288.   let open Linear_format in
  289.   let linear_unit_info, _ = restore filename in
  290.   (match !Clflags.for_package, linear_unit_info.for_pack with
  291.    | None, None -> ()
  292.    | Some expected, Some saved when String.equal expected saved -> ()
  293.    | _, saved -> raise(Error(Mismatched_for_pack saved)));
  294.   let emit_item = function
  295.     | Data dl -> emit_data dl
  296.     | Func f -> emit_fundecl f
  297.   in
  298.   start_from_emit := true;
  299.   emit_begin_assembly ();
  300.   Profile.record "Emit" (List.iter emit_item) linear_unit_info.items;
  301.   emit_end_assembly ()

  303. let compile_implementation_linear output_prefix ~progname =
  304.   compile_unit ~output_prefix
  305.     ~asm_filename:(asm_filename output_prefix) ~keep_asm:!keep_asm_file
  306.     ~obj_filename:(output_prefix ^ ext_obj)
  307.     (fun () ->
  308.       linear_gen_implementation progname)

  310. (* Error report *)

  312. let report_error ppf = function
  313.   | Assembler_error file ->
  314.       fprintf ppf "Assembler error, input left in file %a"
  315.         Location.print_filename file
  316.   | Mismatched_for_pack saved ->
  317.     let msg = function
  318.        | None -> "without -for-pack"
  319.        | Some s -> "with -for-pack "^s
  320.      in
  321.      fprintf ppf
  322.        "This input file cannot be compiled %s: it was generated %s."
  323.        (msg !Clflags.for_package) (msg saved)
  324.   | Asm_generation(fn, err) ->
  325.      fprintf ppf
  326.        "Error producing assembly code for function %s: %a"
  327.        fn Emitaux.report_error err

  329. let () =
  330.   Location.register_error_of_exn
  331.     (function
  332.       | Error err -> Some (Location.error_of_printer_file report_error err)
  333.       | _ -> None
  334.     )
